questions.question: What is a disadvantage of beam search?

answers.a: The search may not result in the optimal solution
answers.b: It may suffer from a lack of diversity in the search space

explanations.c: Beam search may not find the optimal solution and may suffer from a lack of diversity in the search space.

questions.question: In a beam search algorithm with a beam width of 3, how many paths will be explored at each iteration?

answers.d: Number of paths does not depend on the beam width

explanations.b: In a beam search algorithm with a beam width of 3, 3 paths will be explored at each iteration.

questions.question: In stochastic beam search, what does the term stochastic refer to?

answers.a: The use of randomization in selecting paths for exploration
answers.b: The deterministic nature of the search algorithm
answers.c: The focus on exploring a single path at a time
answers.d: The exploration of all possible paths exhaustively

explanations.a: Stochastic beam search uses randomization in selecting paths for exploration.

questions.question: How does local beam search handle ties when selecting the top-k states?

answers.a: It chooses randomly among the tied states
answers.b: It selects states based on their depth in the search tree
answers.c: It uses an additional heuristic to break ties
answers.d: It always selects the first k states

explanations.a: Beam Search algorithms typically choose randomly among the set of best successors if there are more than k.

questions.question: What happens if the beam width is too large relative to the size of the search space?

answers.b: The algorithm degenerates into random search

explanations.a: A very large beam width causes the algorithm to expand most or all nodes, resembling exhaustive search.

questions.question: How does the choice of beam width impact the trade-off between exploration and exploitation in beam search?

answers.a: Increasing the beam width increases exploration but reduces exploitation
answers.b: Increasing the beam width increases both exploration and exploitation
answers.c: Decreasing the beam width increases exploration but reduces exploitation
answers.d: Decreasing the beam width increases both exploration and exploitation

explanations.a: Increasing the beam width allows for more exploration of the search space but may reduce the depth of exploration and exploitation of promising paths.
